title: Family Business Governance
description: This course introduces a framework to guide private and family businesses’ long-term planning. In the course, students seek to understand how entrepreneurs and their family members provide unique assets and contributions leading to the success of the firms, and how various roadblocks challenge the sustainability of the family firm model. It can be realized that the family assets and roadblocks are similar across firms, countries and cultures, and therefore a general framework can be applied to address critical governance decisions including family governance, ownership structures, executive compensation and promotion, and succession and exit, with the aim of improving the well-being of both the firms and the families behind them.

title: Management of the Corporation
requirements: For students in EMBA; or EMBA (Chinese)
description: This course is the prerequisite of all EMBA courses. It provides a business and management view of the modern corporation. The management aspect of the course considers the changing competitive world, the role of corporations in world development, the values of top management, and the vision needed to plan, organize, lead, and control corporate activities. The business aspect of the course integrates the business functions of the corporation such as marketing, finance, human resources, and production in order to accomplish the corporation's goals.
outcome: Individual1. Obtain better understanding about oneself.2. Understand the importance of balancing oneself, family and work.3. Learn about the “Art of success and happiness”. Team 1. Strengthen the team communication and relationship. 2. Learn how to achieve better result and become more productive.  Corporation 1. Understand the importance of accountability for all managers to create value for all stakeholders. 2. Know how to coordinate strategy and execution to ensure success. 3. Learn how to lead with cross-functional perspectives. 4. Obtain experience on how to create success through team coordination in analysis and decision-making in a highly ambiguous, uncertain and competitive marketplace.  Society 1. Understand how to maximize oneself social contribution and the process of defining this. 2. Understand social contribution model, and develop a corporate social integration strategy.

title: Selected Topics in Business and Management
requirements: For students in EMBA; or EMBA (Chinese)
description: This course aims to expose our students to a wide spectrum of global, regional and local business and management issues. To facilitate effective learning, specific topics will be selected for incorporating in this course: examples include trade, economics, technology, finance, market, ventures, politics, corporate governance, management practices, as well as various societal concerns. Throughout this course, lectures, talks, and site visits, in the local and/or international arena, will be conducted to enable students to identify in-depth the gist behind certain selected management and business topics and to come up with insights to help corporations make better decisions in the future. This course consists of an introductory review, followed by an intensive study week in the local and/or international arena. Students have to report their learning and insights with other students after the study week.

title: Emerging Trends in Business and Management
description: Emerging trends in business and management refer to the new and evolving practices, concepts, and approaches that are gaining prominence in the corporate world. These trends often arise in response to technological advancements, changing consumer behaviors, market dynamics, and societal shifts, etc. Embracing these trends can help organizations stay competitive, adapt to market changes, and foster sustainable growth.

title: Adaptive Management in Evolving Environments
description: Adaptive management in evolving environments refers to the practice of adjusting management strategies and approaches to effectively respond to dynamic and changing circumstances. It involves continuously monitoring and assessing the environment, identifying emerging trends and challenges, and making timely adjustments to optimize outcomes. By embracing adaptive management, organizations can anticipate and adapt to emerging trends, capitalize on new opportunities, and mitigate risks. It involves fostering a culture of learning, experimentation, and innovation, etc.

title: Global Business and Management Field Study
requirements: For students in EMBA; or EMBA (Chinese)
description: The goal is to develop students with ability to recognise and effectively respond to management issues and the business environment in global contexts. Students will have the opportunity of realising the opportunities and challenges associated with global business development strategy of a corporation.
outcome: The objectives of the course are, through the design, organization and implementation of a field study outside Hong Kong, to enable the students to:- acquire awareness of, and an appreciation for, the diversity and complexity of the international business environment;- understand the role of analysis of macro dimensions (cultural, demographic, economic, educational, environmental, legal, political, sociological and technological) in making global business decisions;- review contemporary and relevant developments in the global or regional arena, and to explore the possible strategic alternatives to capitalize on changes in the global scenario;- apply business/ management concepts and skills acquired during the EMBA program in a real-life global business context; and- generate insightful and concrete business plans based on the research findings of the field study.

title: Guided Learning in Global Business
description: The course provides students with the opportunity to study a diverse range of Global Business topics through an independent research project supervised by an experienced instructor. This course provides a platform for students to immerse themselves in various aspects of the global business landscape and foster valuable insights and skills. Students enrolled in this course will benefit from academic guidance and mentorship, enabling them to explore specific areas of interest within the field of Global Business. By engaging in comprehensive research and analysis, students will enhance their knowledge of international markets, global trade, cross-cultural management, and other modern business environments. This course is tailored to equip students with the necessary knowledge and expertise to navigate the diverse challenges present in today's global business environments effectively.This course enables students to cultivate their research capabilities, analytical skills, and problem-solving acumen. Students could broaden their perspectives and enhance their research methodologies, they will be encouraged to actively engage with their chosen research areas, enhancing their ability to recognise and effectively respond to management issues and the business environment in global contexts. To enrol in this course, students will be required to seek consent of an instructor after submitting a detailed research proposal outlining the research subject, objectives, and proposed methodology. While students have the flexibility to choose their preferred instructor for guidance, faculty members retain the discretion to accept or decline research students based on the proposal's merit.
outcome: After completing this course, students should be able to: (1) Gain a thorough understanding of diverse Global Business topics through supervised independent research projects.(2) Develop essential skills and insights by exploring various aspects of the global business issues.(3) Enhance research capabilities, analytical skills, and problem-solving acumen to effectively address management issues in global contexts.

title: Monetary Policy and Global Financial Markets
description: This course provides a systematic review of monetary policy making in major central banks (e.g., the Federal Reserve and the People's Bank of China) and the impact of policy on the global financial markets. In addition, the course offers insights on the latest development of macro financial issues in China and the interactions of these new developments within the global financial system.
outcome: Student will be able to:  have a systematic review of monetary policy making in major central banks (e.g., the Federal Reserve and the People's Bank of China) gain insights on the latest development of macro financial issues in China understand the interactions of these new developments within the global financial system

title: Financing Emerging Technology Firms
description: The course will introduce entrepreneurial process and develop skills critical for starting and succeeding in a new technology venture. It emphasizes the framework and skills needed to identify business ideas, recognize entrepreneurial opportunities, raising and structuring financing and making strategic decisions. It will also provide an overview of the PE/VC industry in China, highlighting recent developments and future trends.The experiential learning components such as field trip/company visit etc. may be offered as course components if deemed necessary by course instructors.
